intro: Fimbristylis coleotricha, commonly known as the hairy fringed sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and swamps. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its root system helps stabilize soil in wetland environments, contributing to ecosystem health. Fimbristylis coleotricha is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Asia and Australia.
